intro: Tabernaemontana rotensis, commonly known as the Rotense star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in tropical gardens and greenhouses.
